page.title: 08Landscape In Norton Area.
page.content: The Mad Brook comes from the north west of our area, and joins the River Worfe near Beckbury. This river flows along the east side of our region. The flat land is mostly ploughed up , or sown with grass, but where the brook and river valleys are it is hilly. This land is permanent grassland, with sandstone outcrops. At Higford the land is steep, the sandstone cliffs having caves near the mill,and the woods having mixed trees. The River Worfe runs through where the flash locks have been. There are nettle patches, and in the hilly field to the south east there are thistles. At the bottom of the hills the river meanders through a wide valley, and out of our area.
